head.citation-title: Distributed estimation for spatial rigid motion based on dual quaternions
head.abstracts: Â© 2017 by Taylor & Francis Group, LLC. All rights reserved.This chapter describes distributed algorithms for estimation of spatial rigid motion using multiple image sensors in a connected network. The objective is to increase the estimation precision of translational and rotational motion based on dual quaternion models and cooperation between connected sensors. The dual decomposition subgradient method is applied to decompose the filtering task into a series of suboptimal problems and then solve them individually to achieve the global optimality. Our approach assumes that each sensor can communicate with its neighboring sensors to update the individual estimates. Discussion on converging speed of both methods is provided. Simulation examples are demonstrated to experimentally verify the feasibility of the dual subgradient method in solving rigid body motion estimation problem.

The objective is to increase the estimation precision of translational and rotational motion based on dual quaternion models and cooperation between connected sensors. Simulation examples are demonstrated to experimentally verify the feasibility of the dual subgradient method in solving rigid body motion estimation problem.
